verses.kjv: If ye then be risen with Christ, seek those things which are above, where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God.
verses.web: If then you were raised together with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is, seated on the right hand of God.
verses.ct: Since you have been raised with Christ, focus on the things of heaven, where Christ sits at God's right hand.

verses.kjv: Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.
verses.web: Set your mind on the things that are above, not on the things that are on the earth.
verses.ct: Fix your thoughts on what's above, not on what belongs to this earth.

verses.kjv: For ye are dead, and your life is hid with Christ in God.
verses.web: For you died, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.
verses.ct: After all, you died to your old life, and your true life is now hidden with Christ in God.

verses.kjv: When Christ, who is our life, shall appear, then shall ye also appear with him in glory.
verses.web: When Christ, our life, is revealed, then you will also be revealed with him in glory.
verses.ct: When Christ — who is your life — appears, then you too will appear with him in glory.

verses.kjv: Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth; fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness, which is idolatry:
verses.web: Put to death therefore your members which are on the earth: sexual immorality, uncleanness, depraved passion, evil desire, and covetousness, which is idolatry.
verses.ct: So put to death whatever belongs to your earthly nature: sexual immorality, impurity, uncontrolled lust, evil desires, and greed — which is the same as idolatry.

verses.kjv: For which things’ sake the wrath of God cometh on the children of disobedience:
verses.web: For these things’ sake the wrath of God comes on the children of disobedience.
verses.ct: Because of these things, the wrath of God is coming on those who refuse to obey him.

verses.kjv: In the which ye also walked some time, when ye lived in them.
verses.web: You also once walked in those, when you lived in them;
verses.ct: You used to live that way too, back when those things controlled your life.

verses.kjv: But now ye also put off all these; anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.
verses.web: but now you also put them all away: anger, wrath, malice, slander, and shameful speaking out of your mouth.
verses.ct: But now you must get rid of all of it: anger, rage, malice, slander, and obscene language.

verses.kjv: Lie not one to another, seeing that ye have put off the old man with his deeds;
verses.web: Don’t lie to one another, seeing that you have put off the old man with his doings,
verses.ct: Don't lie to each other, because you've already stripped off your old self and everything it did.

verses.kjv: And have put on the new man, which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him:
verses.web: and have put on the new man, who is being renewed in knowledge after the image of his Creator,
verses.ct: You've put on a new self that is constantly being renewed in knowledge, shaped to reflect the image of the one who created you.

verses.kjv: Where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian, Scythian, bond nor free: but Christ is all, and in all.
verses.web: where there can’t be Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, bondservant, or free person; but Christ is all, and in all.
verses.ct: In this new life, there's no distinction between Greek and Jew, circumcised and uncircumcised, outsider, Scythian, slave, or free person. Christ is everything, and he lives in all of you.

verses.kjv: Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering;
verses.web: Put on therefore, as God’s chosen ones, holy and beloved, a heart of compassion, kindness, lowliness, humility, and perseverance;
verses.ct: Since God chose you — set apart and deeply loved — clothe yourselves with heartfelt compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience.

verses.kjv: Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so also do ye.
verses.web: bearing with one another, and forgiving each other, if any man has a complaint against any; even as Christ forgave you, so you also do.
verses.ct: Bear with each other and forgive anyone who has a grievance against another. Just as Christ forgave you, you must forgive others.

verses.kjv: And above all these things put on charity, which is the bond of perfectness.
verses.web: Above all these things, walk in love, which is the bond of perfection.
verses.ct: Above everything else, put on love — it's the bond that holds all these virtues together in perfect unity.

verses.kjv: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which also ye are called in one body; and be ye thankful.
verses.web: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to which also you were called in one body, and be thankful.
verses.ct: Let the peace of God be the ruling force in your hearts, since you were called to that peace as one body. And be thankful.

verses.kjv: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom; teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.
verses.web: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly; in all wisdom teaching and admonishing one another with psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your heart to the Lord.
verses.ct: Let the word of Christ fill your lives richly. With all wisdom, teach and challenge one another through psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing with gratitude in your hearts to the Lord.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.
verses.web: Whatever you do, in word or in deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father, through him.
verses.ct: Whatever you do — whether in word or action — do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.

verses.kjv: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.
verses.web: Wives, be in subjection to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
verses.ct: Wives, submit to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.

verses.kjv: Husbands, love your wives, and be not bitter against them.
verses.web: Husbands, love your wives, and don’t be bitter against them.
verses.ct: Husbands, love your wives and don't be harsh with them.

verses.kjv: Children, obey your parents in all things: for this is well pleasing unto the Lord.
verses.web: Children, obey your parents in all things, for this pleases the Lord.
verses.ct: Children, obey your parents in everything, because this pleases the Lord.

verses.kjv: Fathers, provoke not your children to anger, lest they be discouraged.
verses.web: Fathers, don’t provoke your children, so that they won’t be discouraged.
verses.ct: Fathers, don't exasperate your children, or they'll become discouraged.

verses.kjv: Servants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh; not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but in singleness of heart, fearing God:
verses.web: Servants, obey in all things those who are your masters according to the flesh, not just when they are looking, as men pleasers, but in singleness of heart, fearing God.
verses.ct: Servants, obey your earthly masters in everything — not just when they're watching, like people who only want to impress others, but with a sincere heart and a genuine fear of God.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
verses.web: And whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord, and not for men,
verses.ct: Whatever you do, throw your whole heart into it, as though you're working for the Lord and not for people.

verses.kjv: Knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ.
verses.web: knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance; for you serve the Lord Christ.
verses.ct: Remember, it's the Lord who will reward you with the inheritance he promised. You are serving the Lord Christ.

verses.kjv: But he that doeth wrong shall receive for the wrong which he hath done: and there is no respect of persons.
verses.web: But he who does wrong will receive again for the wrong that he has done, and there is no partiality.
verses.ct: Anyone who does wrong will be paid back for what they've done. God shows no favoritism.
